Row6:1982, winner Maldonado, runners Villarrica. The aggregate is "1 - 1 , 4 - 3 p". Not sure what that notation means—maybe a penalty shootout? Anyway, the second leg here is 0-1. Not 3-0.

So, in none of the rows is San Pedro listed as a runner-up. So perhaps San Pedro has never been a runner-up, only a winner once in 1984.

Therefore, if the claim says "san pedro be the 2nd place winner," which would imply they were runners-up, but according to the table, San Pedro hasn't been runners-up; they've only won once. So that condition might not hold.

Wait, perhaps I'm misunderstanding the claim. Maybe it's saying that when San Pedro was the runner-up (second place), their second leg score was 3-0. But if in all their wins, like row7, their second leg is 3-0, but they were first place then.
